data.text: The app often says I used my phone while driving when my phone is in my purse on my passenger seat for the whole ride. I wish they would improve that or stop tracking phone use. I'm tired of seeing that I used my phone 6 times when I didn't even look at it, much less touch it. Very frustrated. I think I might have 5 stars if the app worked right.

The Snapshot feature is a safety issue. It incentivizes breaking less, and now I second guess myself when I do require hard braking to avoid collisions. It also doesn't give you a chance to justify the false reports it gives, like it saying the driver used their phone if the passenger actually used their phone or if hard braking was used in the course of defensive driving to avoid a collision. It also doesn't let you go back very far in its history to change when you're a passenger.

The App should not record any "phone use" while someone is parked and stationary! Where's the logic in that? What's the point then in pulling over and STOPPING to use the phone if you're STILL going to be penalized? Might as well just use your phone while you're driving then. Instead of being rewarded for good driving habits the App makes sure you're penalized. Worst. App. Ever.

Constant battery drain. I have to force close it all the time, but then snapshot stops tracking. For example today, the dumb app ran for 9 hours straight and used 13% total battery. I drove for 30 minutes in total today. Such a joke. EDIT: still an issue. Sitting completely idle on the phone without any driving can use up to 8% in a day.

They cant/won't help you on the phone or in chat. If they can help, it's going to cost you. I even tried to stop automatic payments for one month, and they were going to charge me like 40 bucks total, and they said it may or may not stop my automatic payments anyways....if you are new to progressive, go with another company. This is my 3rd poor experience with them, 3 strikes.

This app does not work. I have uninstalled it. reinstalled it. 35 years of driving experience. No tickets, no accidents in 20, 30 years. Why you need my physical activity turned on 24/7, full access to all of my files and media, my contacts, my location with the highest accuracy 24/7 doesn't make sense. why not just when I'm driving? What I pay should not be the based on my physical activity or my personal files and pictures. Or who my contacts are. Where I go, how fast or slow, my brake usage

I'm using this app mostly for Snapshot, and it was off to a great start at first. As of late, it's become selective of when it lets me modify a trip where I was the passenger or driver. In other words, I could've been the passenger, but it tracks me as the driver and won't let me change it otherwise. This isn't for every trip, stangely enough, but it definitely should be fixed.

I don't know if the issue is with the app or the company, but I have had auto pay set up for my entire membership, but when the bill is due, I will get the alert that the bill is paid, I will check the account and it shows that the bill is paid, and about two weeks later I am getting charged a returned transaction fee because they're claiming that they were unable to charge my bank account. The money +$20 is always set aside because I allocate that money for this bill, so I know it's not me.

I ran Snapshot for the required time. According to the app, I would get a $11 discount when I renewed my policy. Instead, my bill went UP $11. During the roughly two years this app has been on my phone, I have had to charge the phone each night and contend with intermitant restarts. Just out of nowhere, it would restart. I removed the app this week. Battery is now on day three and no restarts. I would not recommend this app. It ended up costing me more money, and a lot of aggravation.

App works as intended for an insurance app. Snapshot could use some work. Even though the app suggests plugging my device into the car and using the car's hands free options, which I do 100% of the time while driving, I am still docked for phone use. If I accept a call and only use my car's built in speakers and mic, I am docked for phone use. Android auto is fully launched which should be an indicator that my phone is plugged into the car. Not sure what's going on to cause this.

Runs constantly and drains the battery 2X faster than normal. The snap shot algorithm seems to be written to log mostly just the bad drives. I have noticed that when I drive without incident or calls/text, snap shot does not record those drives. But the moment I get a call or text or get cut off in traffic, it records THAT drive. I could drive for over a week without snap shot recording any of my drives but it'll continue to suck up my battery. Stay away, it's written for you to lose.

Snapshot is the worst. It only collects one side of the events, it charges you with events even when you are using hands free, and it will continue to collect events even after you vehicle has arrived at its destination. You have to constantly change and update the trips in the app...... absolutely NOT worth the time for the little discount it offers!!!!! Progressive WILL NOT listen to your side or be of any help!!!!

Basically the only thing the app is good for is having the digital card which you can just download as a picture or file to your phone and have no need for the app. You can't do anything in the app, it always sends you to their website and even then they make you have to call them to do anything to your account. Terrible service and an extreme hassle. 10/10 do NOT recommend

Like many reviewers, I find Snapshot to be greatly flawed, and seriously wonder if it's on purpose. I go many weeks w/o a brake or acceleration event, but my averages nvr go down. Mathematically, they should. It's as if the values reach a minimum that the program will not permit a lower value. The software engineers haven't figured that out? I doubt it! But tigger a single event and up go the averages w/o hesitation.

I have installed and uninstalled this app many times to get the snapshot discount. Snapshot does not record any data and based on other reviews it appears that nothing is being done to change this issue. I would not recommend this app or snapshot for the sake of the discount. Additionally, all customer service will tell you is to uninstall and reinstall the app

The app is easy to use, but the problem is Progressive's Snapshot counts Bluetooth phone calls as phone activity, even if you don't handle your phone for the whole phone call. So if you drive for 30 min and have a handsfree conversation for 20 min, Snapshot will say phone activity for that stretch of 20 min, and that counts negatively toward your safe driving. Allstate's Drivewise didn't even do that. Their app somehow knew I wasn't actually handling the phone. Now my bill is going up.

Easy to navigate and make changes as you need without compromising security. Everything is in one place for auto and home, etc. As well as being responsive. I did notice that when registering, it timed out but might have been due to the servers syncing recently created policy information. I have not seen any server downtime so far.

This app is not accurate. It sometimes knows when I am driving, sometimes it doesn't. It also may log part of a trip or none of it. Sometimes I am riding as a passenger and it counts me as driving, then I find it difficult to change my status from driver to passenger. Rating does not match app feedback. Primary feedback says 4/5 stars but when I log in, it says 3/5. No reason given and no incidents logged. Or incidents logged when I am a passenger (such as phone use). Confusing to use.

The app is inaccurate about abrupt stops, especially on highway loops. Today I made one stop at a yellow light and it showed three abrupt stops. It also lies about phone usage. Still showing eronius phone use when it passes WiFi. I am buying a hands free car radio to see if it helps. Showing phone use when I'm not even touching the phone.

Doesn't pick up most of my drives, I lost a full ‚≠ê for a 3 min. trip l8night. Wish I could get plugin but prob won't work w/my '95 van. I +2nd car, unable to remove it after learning its not driveable, could remove after a week, but refunded a much smaller portion of $ than plausible to cover days insured. Why did my rate go ‚ÜóÔ∏è that much, that quick? I'm a great driver, your app agrees! My second 6 mo. Payment is WAY more than 1st. Not as good as it's sold to be.

My first red flag with progressive was when my car insurance was $20 more month than what they quoted me as I wish I had gone with my gut and not gone with progressive. From there for the first 4 months they proceeded to charge me late charges every month even though my policy was set up on auto draft. Today my bill went up another $20, All because they found a loophole to get around my state's law in the maximum they can charge you for coverage. Also the app is completely useless.

For having your insurance information available, this is a great app. But the Snapshot is trash! It constantly said I was hard braking. Interestingly, the company I switched to now doesn't say that. Tells me it's the app, not my driving! In the end, I had a high score, but still, my rate went up. What's the point of them tracking me for 6 months just so I can pay more? Went with another company whose app works. After just two months, they say I'll get a better discount on my renewal.

randomly logs me out and forgets my account exists, as in even when i enter all relevant and accurate details in the 2 different account recovery options it cannot find my log in credentials after this happens. i have filed multiple claims in this app, and that was nice when it worked but occasionally I had to try multiple times to upload images. thanks for making stressful times more stressful, you guys are truly progressive.

I was using this app for a long time and I started to notice that it would turn itself on after I turned it off. So for those who bought into the myth about letting the app add another discount for "safe driver", this is why you are assumed to be driving and using your phone. I tried to find any degree of transparency in their terms of service and it doesn't explicitly state they are doing this. Of course, Progressive makes you use their app for everything.

Don't use this app for Snapshot. Even using all hands free options my car has, it still penalized me for "Phone usage". I have an Android, so using Maps, Amazon Music, and even using my cars hands free system for making phone calls, I was amazed to see I was still getting hit for it, even though I purposefully put my phone in the latched armrest. After a couple days of seeing that, I contacted them and switched to the plug in device. Not to mention, the app constantly ran and drained the battery

Snap Shot, specifically, is terrible. It doesn't record most trips that I drive and only allows a few days to go into the app and tap through several annoying screens to verify the mode of transit. That being said, I've gotten dinged several times for not changing myself to passenger in time after riding with someone else. Geico's drive easy is not perfect but it's way better than progressive's snap shot

I will say it was great getting an unbeatable rate when I signed up, but all my problems stemmed from the snapshot side. my transports throughout the week from me driving is solely 15%. and I'm surprised nobody has offered the plug-in device for the vehicles. which I barely found out just a few days ago. if I had this device from the beginning it would have saved so much headache I've been having with both progressive and snapshot for the past couple of months

Hated using this app! Does not take into consideration the road conditions for hard brakes usage. I live in a construction zone area and have to use hard brakes to avoid accidents when people aren't paying attention and cut me off. Also I use a "hands-free" on board Bluetooth car device and sometimes have to make and receive phone calls for directions or information and those are shown as negative events. My insurance went up because of this! I do not want to use this app any longer!

I can't really review any part of the app but Snapshot which is just frustrating. I use hands-free Bluetooth and constantly get dinged for phone use even if I don't answer. It has marked hard brake which I completely disagree with. Lately, several trips (sometimes for days) aren't even recorded. And lastly, if I am a passenger in someone else's vehicle, i have to go into snapshot and change status to passenger. If my premiums are going to be determined by snapshot, then it needs to be accurate.

Most non-transparent premium charges/billing i have ever experienced -- to the point that it looks like they charge whatever they like and refuse to explain. Almost all discounts are not itemized to show amount saving (only the pay in full discount). I went with the hugely glitchy and annoying Snapshot -- was told my discount increased from $53 to $160+ for my A+ driving: my renewal is an actual increase of $30. No Snapshot savings increase at all and they wont explain.

Was fine until I opted for SNAPSHOTü§®! Now after 3 years without an incident I'll be finding a new Insurer. Thanks to their tracking app that penalizes your driving "score" for using using your hands-free phone. They're hinting at a rate increase. Adios Progressive üëé! 1/22/21 This is a response to your reply. I guess I have to repeat myself üôÑ. I only use the buttons on my steering wheel to make and accept calls. Also I don't have to "glance at my map". My vehicle has its own Nav display!
data.replyText: While you‚Äôre driving with the app version of Snapshot¬Æ, we measure any handheld phone use. Handsfree calls or apps (like streaming music or GPS directions) are fine, but interacting with your phone during a trip (e.g. picking it up to glance at the map) could hurt your results in some states. To review one of your trips, call us at 1-877-329-7283.

data.text: The app is not user friendly. The snap shot didn't even track every time I was driving and then i didn't get a discount unless they tracked enough of my driving. I used to have insurance with them years ago and it was great. This time I've had to cancel. They lie about how much I'll be paying and then can only pay less if I let them track me. I had to cancel and went somewhere else. WAY BETTER. More coverage and cheaper.

Kind of an odd review, because I really don't use the app often. I only have one "product" through it, but it does exactly what I need it to do, when I need to do it, without difficulty. Digital copies of my insurance info, quick payment, simple & intuitive interface. No intrusive notifications, and it doesn't advertise "extras" to me. There are distinct limitations on the built in functionality, but what it does, it does *very* well. The model of a well designed and effectively built app!

Decent but tracking is invasive. Thankfully it seems we can turn tracking off. If we are tracked I will never use progressive for insurance again when I need it. There is no need for an insurance company to track their customer's movements, it's invasive. Hopefully they don't remove the option(s) to turn it off. It is convenient for those that want it, invasive and offensive to me.

The app kinda sucks because every single time I use it I have to go through the "forgot password" ritual even though I just changed it and recorded it, it makes me jump through that hoop...EVERY TIME ! even if I just jumped through it one minute before. The "remember me" option doesn't work either, I guess because everytime I log on I have to do the change password deal. Hope I never need the app in a hurry.
data.replyText: Thanks for reaching out about your password. We‚Äôd like to learn more about your experience‚Äîwe can work on a solution or provide other options that will allow you to quickly access your policy info. When you have time, please call us.

data.text: They said my rates can't go up, only down. Not so. The app said I brake suddenly too often. Actual passengers have commented on how smooth my driving is. And the app flagged a trip where I was a passenger, where the trip was very smooth. Or maybe you use your phone for navigation, or podcasts, or music while you drive; the app will flag those as "phone use" too.

The app itself is easy enough to navigate with a clean interface. The insurance, though, is crazy expensive. That is all I will say on that. They might have nice features to offer, but you will pay out of your butthole for it. Also if you don't have their driver app (Snapshot) to track your driving they will charge you more. I went with another company. Will never recommend Progressive.

Ux is fine for the most part. It's a bit annoying you have to redirect to browser to make changes. It defeats the purpose of having the app. The most annoying thing is that the snapshot app dings you for forgetting to shut down apps and or turn off the screen when you put your phone down or in your pocket even if there isn't any direct interaction with your device. I have noticed also I have been dinged in the past simply for silencing the ringer by pressing the volume key.

This app is not even close to ready for use. I installed it, activated finger print then closed it. Tried to reopen and it takes about 3 minutes to launch. Doesn't recognize my credentials, doesn't let me use fingerprint. I figured I must have to reset password. It sent me email, instructs me to click reset password... Which launches Google play store. I've tried this 3 times with save results. You guys might want to consider using experienced coders, and do some testing.

New Progressive client, and I agree with most... The Snap Shot portion of the app is awful. Does not record my trips correctly or, most of the time, at all. I have called Progressove and spoken to many reps. I agree with most reviews. Even if you do not touch your phone, it states an event with your phone. I rarely use my phone, hands dree, while driving. I do not know what else to do.

This app is designed to make you fail, so you have to pay more on your insurance . It gives you points for just looking at your phone for a second at a stop light, if you have to brake hard to prevent running into a deer, or other animal, or when your car self brakes because someone else cut in front of you unexpectedly and made a hard stop moving less than 3 mph. The app is designed so that progressive wins. And, there is no way to dispute when the app is wrong!
data.replyText: Thanks for reaching out! We‚Äôd like to get in touch to answer all your questions about Snapshot. Please call us at 1-877-329-RATE (1-877-329-7283).‚ÄØOur Snapshot team is‚ÄØhere to help Monday through Saturday, from‚ÄØ8:00 am to 12:00 am‚ÄØET.

data.text: Signed up to use snapshot starting at the end of the month, went ahead and turned on the app. Already draining my battery more than 2x what was before, throughout the day. Will update review if it starts to be worth it but considering just uninstalling until my actual plan goes into effect. It should not be running if it is detected to be at my home wifi, seems simple enough. Edit to response: I'm not driving is the issue, this is just at home. Being stationary. Which is the issue I said.
data.replyText: We‚Äôre sorry it‚Äôs draining your battery. You can keep your battery in good shape while driving with the app if you charge your phone while driving. This will also make sure we're gathering all your trip information. Keep in mind‚Äîif your battery goes below 20%, we stop collecting your trip to help save your battery life.

data.text: Progressive is fine as an insurer, but what I do know is that the snapshot data tracker is a scam. It sells your driving data, so they are already making money off you. In my opinion, it makes me drive worse do too, not knowing what a "hard break" is. The app provides no data or analytics on how to improve, just basic suggestions. I will never use them again.
data.replyText: Thanks for reaching out! We‚Äôd like to get in touch to answer all your questions about Snapshot. Please call us at 1-877-329-RATE (1-877-329-7283).‚ÄØOur Snapshot team is‚ÄØhere to help Monday through Saturday, from‚ÄØ8:00 am to 12:00 am‚ÄØET.

data.text: It's odd why Progressive Snapshot encourages you to bring your phone while driving and then penalizes you with an "event" for phone use everytime your phone lights up. This happens with navigation or someone calls or texts even if you don't touch your phone or even look at it. Heck, if you pull over to make a call, you get penalized. Just makes no sense. And yet no penalty to people who have nav systems on their dash, which is a glaring distraction.
data.replyText: Thanks for reaching out! We‚Äôd like to get in touch to answer all your questions about Snapshot. Please call us at 1-877-329-RATE (1-877-329-7283).‚ÄØOur Snapshot team is‚ÄØhere to help Monday through Saturday, from‚ÄØ8:00 am to 12:00 am‚ÄØET.

data.text: Nice to have policy info in app, but the snapshot portion is terrible. I only use Bluetooth - my phone is kept locked out of my reach but it still counts every phone call as handheld distracted driving. They do not provide any transparency on how different events could potentially affect your score/rates. Given the loss of privacy with full phone app and location access, I don't think the savings could be worth the gamble. Called snapshot 2x, suggestions: phone mount (distracts) or wait/see ($).
data.replyText: Thanks for reaching out! We‚Äôd like to get in touch to answer all your questions about Snapshot. Please call us at 1-877-329-RATE (1-877-329-7283).‚ÄØOur Snapshot team is‚ÄØhere to help Monday through Saturday, from‚ÄØ8:00 am to 12:00 am‚ÄØET.

data.text: I am so disappointed with my Snapshot app experience. I do everything handsfree, and i get "events" for phone use, even though I'm switching songs, or changing the volume on my steering wheel. Isn't that the point? I took a bluetooth call and got "100% phone use". So, yeah, having Officer Progressive in the car is not fun. I've even gotten an "event" and nothing is even documented. Like, what?? Don't use this app!!!!
data.replyText: Thanks for reaching out! We‚Äôd like to get in touch to answer all your questions about Snapshot. Please call us at 1-877-329-RATE (1-877-329-7283).‚ÄØOur Snapshot team is‚ÄØhere to help Monday through Saturday, from‚ÄØ8:00 am to 12:00 am‚ÄØET.

data.text: It's a real bummer when you need service and the whole system is down: app, customer service, roadside, etc. Today, I had to pay for roadside service out of pocket because they couldn't verify coverage that I've been paying for for almost 2 years. It makes me want to go to another company when that happens. I'm definitely going to be doing around after that... I need a company that's reliable and can meet my needs whenever I need them to. As far as insurance apps go, it meets the need
data.replyText: We're sorry for the delay in being able to reach us about roadside assistance. Systems are back online now and we‚Äôre ready to help. Please submit your Roadside invoices for reimbursement consideration at https://www.progressiveroadside.com/.

data.text: Snapshot is garbage, it is designed for people with "normal" schedules. If you work nights or weekends you will be penalized. Full stop Also, when I close the app, I don't want to have to go to the settings and force close it every time because it wants to continue tracking info that you can't have deleted. No idea what all it's phoning home about when I'm not using the app.

I tried several times to enroll in the snap shot program. It sent me a code, but once I put the code in it stated that it couldn't recognized the code. I did while on the phone with The snap shot agent Jasity. We I opened it it stated that it had taken care of some problems, but apparently these problems remains. I have tried several times with the app. It's is frustrating. I had to get the device to put on my car. I really would have rather use the phone app. Hope this not happening to others

Just wish it was easier to change payment dates to coincide with my paychecks. Also hate that you can't change certain pay dates. Not sure if I'm missing it, but I also wish there were better and earlier notifications for the automatic payments. That would be really helpful because I tend to get forgetful with all the stresses of life, and it sucks getting charged those missed/late payment fees.
data.replyText: We‚Äôre sorry the info you‚Äôre searching for is missing from the app. We‚Äôre here to help. Please contact us from the Help Center. Thanks for letting us know about this‚Äîwe can‚Äôt wait to connect and figure this out!‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

data.text: Don't use snapshot. I have a good driving record with little to no use of phone, almost no hard brakes and overall good stats. Started noticing that I was getting dinged for phone use so I got in the habit of turning off bluetooth, closed all apps and putting my phone in the glove compartment. Somehow I'm still getting dinged? They increased my payments due to this and I'm down to 1 star with, again, overall good starts. What a scam
data.replyText: Thanks for reaching out! We‚Äôd like to get in touch to answer all your questions about Snapshot. Please call us at 1-877-329-RATE (1-877-329-7283).‚ÄØOur Snapshot team is‚ÄØhere to help Monday through Saturday, from‚ÄØ8:00 am to 12:00 am‚ÄØET.

data.text: Bad experience from beginning to end errors, them canceling my collision accidently (I guess) that I have never used in 50 years driving but I needed it 6 weeks ago and it wasn't there they said they went back through all my communications they didn't find anything of me canceling it so Then they said "well You didn't pay for collisions so You Don't got it" even though I paid what they told me to pay assuming I had collision Which initially showed up on the declaration page. Much more

Didn't get an option to edit my last review for some reason. App didn't start for most of the time I've had it installed. I reinstalled it like 2-3 times and I finally got it to open. It worked for a bit, but now it freezes when I try to select my location for roadside assistance. I'm currently stuck I'm an an isolated area frequented by homeless. This isn't okay.
data.replyText:
We‚Äôre sorry you couldn‚Äôt submit your request for roadside assistance from the app. Please give us a call at 1-800-776-2778 if you still need assistance. 

We‚Äôd like to find a solution so this doesn‚Äôt happen again, but we need more info. Please send us an email from the login screen. If you‚Äôre already logged in, select ‚ÄúReport a Bug‚Äù from the menu.

data.text: More difficult than it should be to setup app and snapshot for multiple drivers, and half the stuff on the app redirects you to the website or a phone number that'll have you on hold for 10+ minutes. Also, seems to be an overarching issue with Snapshot detecting normal, average braking as hard braking. I drive a couple miles to and from work with almost no stopping and have this issue. It gets the bare minimum done.

Snapshot device drained my car battery, causing me to need a jump several times. Car battery tests fine. Sent it back, started Snapshot app. App's "decisions" are hokey, like when I pulled over to use my Google maps, but it counted it as phone use while driving. When I called about that they said to leave the car to use Google Maps to not be counted as using phone- in winter! Ended up with an A on it, but to keep my rates lower, they want me to keep using the app. Scam.

The Progressive app no longer works on my phone. I have installed and unstalled over and over again. The message," Progressive will close" pops ups. I tried just downloading the snapshot app and the app says it moved to the progressive app. The app no longer works. What is the next solution if the app refuses to open? Relying on an app is not a good thing.
data.replyText: Thanks for reaching out! We‚Äôd like to get in touch to answer all your questions about Snapshot. Learn more about Snapshot at https://www.progressive.com/auto/discounts/snapshot/snapshot-faq/. Or you can give us a call at 1-877-329-RATE (1-877-329-7283). Our Snapshot team is here to help Monday through Saturday, from 8:00 am to 12:00 am ET.

data.text: Not a good insurance company. Shady at best. And the app is just awful. Insurance increases EVERY 6 months, and if you are not in AutoPay, they will add an additional $20 to your rate. They will cancel your policy then still expect you to pay the full 6 months remaining balance. Don't pay for this. It is overpriced and your pretty much paying for the name 'Progressive' and their advertising commercials.. That is it. There are cheaper insurances through local towns.
data.replyText: Thanks for reaching out about this. We‚Äôre sorry there was confusion about your policy cancellation and coverage. We don‚Äôt offer policy support here, but we‚Äôd like to get in touch about this. Please call us at 1-800-Progressive.

data.text: It doesn't save my sorted trips. It goes back to what the app assumed my position in the car/on the trip was. Which defeats the purpose of the app. It impacts my rate with no customer service support line to correct it. And when it is locked in, it can't be changed. So we're being cheated. I have to Uninstall and reinstall to "fix it"

Nothing I ever try to do on the app works. I press a payment button, and it changes color like I pressed it, and the app becomes totally unresponsive. I try to get to my renter's insurance, and every download fails. Eventually I just got sent back to the login page, where the password I just entered didn't work, so I have to set a new password every time I want to log in. I've literally never got anything to work on this app besides seeing my balance.
data.replyText: We‚Äôre sorry about your experience using the app. Making sure you can count on the app is important to us, so thanks for letting us know about this. We want to find a solution, but we need some help. When you have a minute, please email us from the app. We just need your policy number and anything else you‚Äôd like to share.

data.text: Had hail damage to my cars. Progressive wouldn't send out adjusters so I had to download this app. The app asks for permissions it doesn't need and if you decline it force closes and logs you out. Had to log in at least 5 times to change permissions for location and microphone. App asks you to take photos of things that aren't there. Would rather have had an Adjuster than doing Progressive's job for them.
data.replyText: We‚Äôre sorry we can‚Äôt be there for you in person right now due to COVID-19. But we are here for you over the phone. If you have any questions about your estimate or claim, please reach out to your claim rep. Thanks for your feedback.

data.text: App is fine but progressive sucks. They were easy to set up a policy with but are so quick to cancel over any problems instead of trying to work it out first, ive set up two separate policies within a month of each other and both times I got an email from progressive saying that they were cancel and to call them and give them info from people even outside of my home! In order to save the policies. These are people who have literally nothing to do with my life or vehicle. Progressive is the worst

The snapshot Mobil app is a joke! Apparently I don't go anywhere without stomping on my breaks! I'm always on my phone, even when it's in my purse! Any heaven forbid you cancel, they "remove" your discount and charge you more! I have a hum by Verizon that plugs into my car it's basically the same as the snapshot. It says my driving score is between 95 and 100% always! Snapshot has me 1 out of 5 stars and tells me I need to improve my driving or I'm getting a rate increase! Do better!

Incorrectly reports phone usage all the time. I use android auto and/or Bluetooth for music and can literally put my phone in my pocket and never touch it but it will report x percentage of phone usage. It also constantly misclassified trips where I am not the driver. I also really hate having to share so much data with them or any app. Otherwise the app works well enough for policy lookup, etc ...
data.replyText: Thanks for reaching out! We‚Äôd like to get in touch to answer all your questions about Snapshot. Please call us at 1-877-329-RATE (1-877-329-7283).‚ÄØOur Snapshot team is‚ÄØhere to help Monday through Saturday, from‚ÄØ8:00 am to 12:00 am‚ÄØET.

data.text: Update: I have a Google Pixel 3 phone that shoots 4k video by default. When I changed it to 1040p I was able to successfully upload. That may have been it or the fact that i did it early in the morning when their server traffic would be lower. Tried to use the file a claim feature and use the photo estimate feature. App hung at 92% while uploading photos and video. It's been over two hours now. Looked great but now ...

I was rear ended by a cement truck with progressive insurance. By far the worst claim experience I have ever had, with their "photo estimate" of the damages to my car! First the text messages wouln't show up on my phone, then the app wouln't accept the code, and when I tried to look up my claim, the app couldn't find it. They claim this is the only way to get an estimate without taking the car to a repair shop. If you have progressive cancel them!

I've been with Progressive for 5+ years now. I had one small, at fault accident, and my rate has never gone up. In fact, it's only gone down. Never had any issues with the claim, the app is excellent and easy to navigate. Customer service has always been kind and eager to help. I would highly recommend Progressive to anyone.
data.replyText: Thank you so much for your review!

data.text: I'm a bit disappointed with progressive insurance. So they kinda had me over a barrel for the past 2 years but I figured that was due to me having an accident on my history. Long story short, the accident came off and they raised my insurance $100/6 months to $940. But I did get an $8 discount for 3 year good driver, woot. Saved $340 with switching to Geico and got more insurance, roadside and rental in addition. When calling to cancel my policy, no attempt made to retain my business.

Everytime I open the app it has me logged out even though I check the "remember me" option. And then I have to go through changing the password all over again. Not that it matters since Progressive decided to raise my rates for absolutely no reason. I will be canceling soon. 10+ years of being a customer (with a spotless driving record) doesn't mean a thing to this greedy company. Shame on you Progressive.

Snapshot is great when it works, but it only works for a maximum of 5 days or so and then it breaks. It stops collecting my data, says snapshot needs attention, and then I need to redownload the app resign in and we get set up for snapshot. It's ridiculous. Every time it says I have phone usage in the app, it's for 0.1% of the trip when I've never used my phone while I drove. I better not get a worse rate because of the way the app is running.

The app is constantly running in the background using about 15% of my battery. I can no longer go a full day in a charge with this app installed. Following up to comment. I only drive 4 miles to work. Most of the time it isn't worth taking out of my pocket, let alone plug it in. The amount of power used by the app during the day is way more than the charge I would get while driving. I almost replaced my phone/phone battery thinking that the battery was failing. Was the app.
data.replyText: We‚Äôre sorry it‚Äôs draining your battery. You can keep your battery in good shape while driving with the app if you charge your phone while driving. This will also make sure we're gathering all your trip information. Keep in mind‚Äîif your battery goes below 20%, we stop collecting your trip to help save your battery life.

data.text: App does not have ID/proof-of-insurance-card in the app. It has a button for it, but it just takes you to the progressive website, where you have to comb through pdf after pdf with arbitrary titles to find one that resembles an ID card. the closest thing to an ID card is a document that more closely resembles a receipt if you ask me. the document works, but a simple proof of insurance ID card accessible via the app is kinda the only thing I'd use this app for.

This is the absolute worst App I've ever tried to use. It simply doesn't work. I am unable to log in or even set up an account so I can't even view my bill anymore. It says it will send me an email to finish setting up an account but then it never sends the email. It is absolutely useless!! I just called and switched back to getting a paper bill in the mail. At least I'll be able to see my bill again. It is a totally useless App and I highly recommend not wasting your time!!

Very Annoyed with Progressive. Rates beat my other insurance company hands down. There are two apps to download. One for insurance payments and insurance info. The other called Snapshot. Snapshot is supposed to monitor your driving skills, but really screws up saying you are using your cellphone (i.e. "DISTRACTED DRIVER") THE ONLY OPTION since the snapshot app doesn't work that well is to install a device in each of your vehicles although it doesn't matter who is driving.

Been with progressive over a year, and the price has gone up each time I renewed my policy, even though I have 0 tickets or accidents, and qualified for multiple discounts. I switched to another insurance, saving me $365 per year. When I cancelled my account they charged me an additional $50 for processing, plus the non-refundable agent fee of $35. I was paying $765 yr with them while the new company is charging only $400 per year with no hidden fees. I will never recommend them to anyone, including my enemies. No one deserves to be treated like I was.

cannot setup auto payments on the app. constantly have to make calls to adjust a policy. when I do I get transferred around to several different people because no one understands their policies. I'll schedule a payment, it goes through log back in and find out the amount due did not include the monthly processing fee and I have to make a separate payment for that. the app is only good for making payments and getting id cards, but I don't think I can even do that now that I have commercial.
data.replyText: We‚Äôre sorry we couldn‚Äôt connect you with the correct department when you called us. Let‚Äôs get in touch another way. Please email us at App_Feedback@progressive.com. We have a whole team ready to help! Thanks for letting us know about this.

data.text: My only complaint is that the app continues to run nonstop even after snapshot has finished collecting driving data. It doesn't show in-app that its tracking or anything, but it just constantly runs in the background. I've taken every permission away I can, and it continues to sit in my notifications tab until I clear out background apps, only to return. I don't have anything to complain about otherwise.
data.replyText: Thanks for reaching out! We‚Äôd like to get in touch to answer all your questions about Snapshot. Learn more about Snapshot at https://www.progressive.com/auto/discounts/snapshot/snapshot-faq/. Or you can give us a call at 1-877-329-RATE (1-877-329-7283). Our Snapshot team is here to help Monday through Saturday, from 8:00 am to 12:00 am ET.

data.text: I just started using, but the snapshot portion sucks. Normal breaking is registered as hard breaking; a phone is a lightweight device, of course it's going to move. For my sake, I hope it doesn't ever fall off the mount. I get docked for phone use even when I answer the phone hands free (Am I supposed to ignore calls?), and it can't tell if there's a passenger using my phone either. I wished I had looked into Snapshot before enrolling in it; it's too sensitive to obtain accurate info.

Same, purchased a policy about two weeks ago, downloaded the app and it has yet to log anything. Just shows "we havent heard from you, be sure to keep your phone on you etc. Be sure to keep the app installed. Also that annoying progressive is running that never goes away. Snapshot is saving me 78$ but in the long run its just an extra 13 and some change a month. I'd rather pay that then have my payments double

data.userName: ONE OF MANY MANY OF ONE
data.text: I prefer the app because ease of access and security. It's a time saver for those of us that make every minute count as well. Just about 3 clicks to pay too. It's a really well streamlined and put together app, no clutter and straight to the point. No frustrations and easy to use. I sometimes get an error code when submitting payment's, but I think it's due to the time of the day. I just usually try it again mid day, the following day and everything is all good. üëçüòÅüëç

Every single aspect of obtaining insurance with Progressive has been really simple! They're really nice and I would recommend them to anyone needing insurance for any vehicle at all. In addition, I could easily understand every conversation I've had with them on the phone...no weird accent to deal with! I fully intend to keep them forever!

They sucker you in with a good rate for the first six months. Absolutely nothing about my driving record changed but my rate increased by $200.00 for the next six months. I changed to State Farm! Bait and switch all the way. Very deceptive business practices. Take advantage of the 6 month savings but make sure to shop for a replacement for the next 6 months. Thank you State Farm. My rates actually went "down" for my 2nd term with State Farm. Bite me Progressive!

I installed the app after being prompted by Progressive in order to view the results of our snapshot progresses. Well that was pointless since the Progressive app doesn't provide me with any of that info. That was a why bother, thanks for nothing installation. I prefer to minimize the number of apps installed and running on my phone, especially when they are pointless and serve no purpose.
data.replyText: Thanks for reaching out! We‚Äôd like to get in touch to answer all your questions about Snapshot. Learn more about Snapshot at https://www.progressive.com/auto/discounts/snapshot/snapshot-faq/. Or you can give us a call at 1-877-329-RATE (1-877-329-7283).‚ÄØOur Snapshot team is‚ÄØhere to help Monday through Saturday, from‚ÄØ8:00 am to 12:00 am‚ÄØET.

data.text: don't do the snapshot app on your phone; not only does it falsely detect phone usage while driving even if it goes through your Bluetooth, you can't update your trips as a passenger or not being the one driving after 5 days. Your score also goes down if you don't drive at the same time every day, or if you're driving in an "unfamiliar" area -- no matter how safe you drive.

I like how they prompt you to leave a review. recently started my new policy, found out there's a hidden fee.. Everything looks fine at first, until a month later. When I did not opt in for their third-party, safe driving App; adding $115 to my bill. Insurance companies are such a sleazy, scheming, trap. but you have to have it, or you'll go to jail üá∫üá∏.

The built in snapshot is the worst software I have ever used. It puts events in driving even though the phone is stable. Also you literally can't use GPS if you trying to hit a good score. After every ride, I see 10-20+ events of phone use, when the phone is literally on GPS holder and using GPS. Now they saying to improve driving for better score otherwise my insurance will go up. Whoever created this snapshot "IMPROVE YOUR SOFTWARE TO KNOW THINGS FIRST"

I've noticed an issue with snapshot on the phone, while having my phone connected to the car through USB and Android Auto running it miss reads as I'm active using my phone. My phone's screen doesn't turn off while connected to USB, I'm not sure if that could be why but I use Google voice assistant while driving. Would there be a way I could switch to the plug in device?
data.replyText: Thanks for reaching out! We‚Äôd like to get in touch to answer all your questions about Snapshot. Please call us at 1-877-329-RATE (1-877-329-7283).‚ÄØOur Snapshot team is‚ÄØhere to help Monday through Saturday, from‚ÄØ8:00 am to 12:00 am‚ÄØET.

data.text: I have always had exceptional prompt service from Progressive over the years and have only occasionally changed to Geico when it was occasionally cheaper. Progressive stood up for me when I was involved in an accident and they prevented my finances and thus my life from taking an even more serious downturn than just the results of the accident years ago. I think they could be a bit more competitive with their pricing however.

I've been a progressive customer for five years and have been using the app the whole time. I use the finger print verification for easy log in. The app is easy to navigate, imo. The app provides policy info, billing history, roadside assistance info, etc. At each renewal date I'd received a reminder and I could download / view the updated insurance card. Also, every time I called in the customer service reps were excellent and friendly. I'll miss progressive.
data.replyText: Thank you for your five-star review!

data.text: When requesting roadside service, you can't just type in the address. You get a map and have to verify the address by getting the pointer to locate the specific place. When I finally got it to come up with my address, it jumped as I clicked to verify. As a result, I had to call Progressive to prevent the tow truck from going to a location two blocks from where I was. It would have been easier and more accurate to have been able to just type in the address.

Using the app to take pictures of my damage was ridiculous. I took all the pics the text told me I would need then when I went into the app for the claim I couldn't use the original pictures and I had to take all new ones. Your instructions are very hard to read in the bright day light but you tell me to do it outside when my car is well lit. Not a great experience!

Bad update. Used to be helpful for basic needs, but since the July 19, 2023 update (automatic on my device) it began stopping in the background. I hadn't opened it since the beginning of the month, so I didn't know why it suddenly started bugging out. Tried opening the app just now, but it won't open because it stops immediately. So I'll have to use the website exclusively unless and until that bug is fixed.
data.replyText: Thanks for letting us know that our app won‚Äôt open. We‚Äôre sorry about that. Please email us at App_Feedback@progressive.com. All we need to know is your policy number, but you can always include other details if you think they‚Äôre related.

data.text: I used the snapshot app. I maintained an A rating for the 6 months since I purchased progressive insurance and signed up with Snapshot. Prior to switching my insurance to progressive I had an excellent rating. do not use snapshot even with a good rating and expect a decrease in your premium. when I finish one year with progressive I will switch my insurance.

It creates hard brake instances even when there no hard brakes. Not a good app. If you are going at 55 mph and you are 8 seconds away from Signals and it turns yellow. Now normal following distance is 3 to 4 seconds. But in this scenario even if you come to complete stop in 8 second app is recording 3 to 4 hard brake instances. In rush hours even if you try to create a 4 second following distance other cars will jump in front. This app's calculation are two harsh with drivers.
data.replyText: Thanks for reaching out! We‚Äôd like to get in touch to answer all your questions about Snapshot. Please call us at 1-877-329-RATE (1-877-329-7283).‚ÄØOur Snapshot team is‚ÄØhere to help Monday through Saturday, from‚ÄØ8:00 am to 12:00 am‚ÄØET.

data.text: I just saw a notice that I owed a dollar from account setup. The agent could have taken it that day, but told me they would bill me. To date I have not received a bill, but I did get a late notice. I paid immediately, and app says I will get a confirmation email. how about that! but to date no bill or invoice of any kind to remind me. I guess its an easy way to cause a customer some trouble. PS, the dollar would have been paid initially, but the agent seemed to forget what we had discussed

App and service are terrible. Can't access most information on the app and are redirected to a web page instead making the app mostly pointless. Had progressive run into an issue processing my card via auto pay, my card was fine, their system had the error. Only warning they gave was was right before canceling my service, which i got late so my insurance got cancelled. After paying extra fees for reinstatement for their mistake, I'm also noticing my rate has doubled. Stay away.
data.replyText: Thanks for reaching out! We don‚Äôt offer policy support here, but you can get in touch with us anytime at 1-800-PROGRESSIVE or progressive.com. We‚Äôre more than ready to help!

data.text: App isn't bad BUT will never go back. with the insurance! Has progressive for years only for my rates to keep going up & up!! I have a perfect driving record. The only thing on report was an accident that was NOT my fault. However EVERY time I was to renew my insurance it went up!!!! By the time I chancged insurances I was paying $152.?? for a PERFECT record!!! I changed & ended up paying almost half of what I was paying!!! I see now "you" will pay for all their bad advertising!!!!

I'll be switching to Geico when my policy ends. It's 1/3 the price and the user experience of the app and website, at least on mobile are horrible. I forgot my password and was sent a link to change it. I click the link and it asks me a few questions for verification, and once I click submit it just brings me right back to log in without the option of entering in a new password.

This app needs to be updated in a big way. It does NOT record the trips correctly. I went out for lunch about 45 minutes each way and it recorded only half way on my returned trip. My wife had her location on and the app doesn't record it for some days and then recorded some other days. My daughter drove today and I was the passenger and the app showed that she used her phone 40% eventhough she didn't use the phone. ü§£ü§£ü§£ Thinking of switching to another insurance provider.
data.replyText: Thanks for reaching out! We‚Äôd like to get in touch to answer all your questions about Snapshot. Please call us at 1-877-329-RATE (1-877-329-7283).‚ÄØOur Snapshot team is‚ÄØhere to help Monday through Saturday, from‚ÄØ8:00 am to 12:00 am‚ÄØET. You can also learn more about Snapshot at https://www.progressive.com/auto/discounts/snapshot/snapshot-faq/.

data.text: Decent app overall. I would give it 5 stars but my only complaint is I can only access my auto and commercial insurance policies on this app. I also have homeowners insurance with Progressive but I can't access it on this app. I have to go to the website. Oh well, not a huge problem, just be more convenient if I could access all my policies on this app.

Works ok, layout isn't great, the chat support is only a bot, no way to contact a person through it, just makes you call. Person I called was nice and helpful but it was a long wait. I have snapshot and it suddenly stopped logging trips a month ago, turns out it no longer needed to, I did well so it was satisfied i guess, problem is, it never told me. Additionally, on the app it specifically said I needed to take action cause "we haven't heard from you in a while" or something like that.
data.replyText: Thanks for reaching out! You can learn more about Snapshot at https://www.progressive.com/auto/discounts/snapshot/snapshot-faq/. If you still have questions, give us a call at 1-877-329-RATE (1-877-329-7283).‚ÄØOur Snapshot team is‚ÄØhere to help Monday through Saturday, from‚ÄØ8:00 am to 12:00 am‚ÄØET.
